author: Angela Swartz
title: Elon Musk unveils when Tesla's Model 3 budget vehicle will start production
text:
Enlarge Daniel Acker A Tesla Motors logo appears on the side of a Tesla Model S electric sedan. Tesla Motors… more Tesla Motors Inc., chief executive officer Elon Musk took to Twitter on Wednesday to share that the company's smaller and more affordable vehicle will go into production in two years. Although it's already been shared that the Model 3 Sedan will cost $35,000, it wasn't certain when the Palo Alto-based electric company's car would actually be available. The company has said the car will be available in sedan and crossover models with a 200-mile battery, making it affordable to middle-class drivers (currently you can buy a Model S for about $70,000). Get A.M.business scoops. Subscribe to SVBJ's free morning email newsletter. Musk also wrote Wednesday that the car will be unveiled in March and pre-orders will start then, too. This is in line with what Tesla said earlier this summer about revealing its Model 3 design during the first quarter of 2016. It also said first deliveries are expected in late 2017. A June report stated that the vehicle's debut would be pushed from 2017 to 2018, but Tesla denied the report. Tesla's first sport utility vehicle, the Model X, will launch this fall. The company has updated its retail outlets to coincide with the upcoming release .
